derivation: from an unused root meaning to clothe;
outline:
1. shoulder, shoulder-blade, side, slope
    1. shoulder, shoulder-blade (of man)
    2. shoulder, shoulder-pieces (of animals)
    3. side, slope (of mountain)
    4. supports (of laver)
strongs_def: the shoulder (proper, i.e. upper end of the arm; as being the spot where the garments hang); figuratively, side-piece or lateral projection of anything
